bibl.title: Letter fragment from [Henry Rose Carter] to [Laura Eugenia Hook Carter?], [19--?]

div1.p: [Carter] writes about the weather and his daughter, Laura.

div1.head: Letter fragment from [Henry Rose Carter] to [Laura Eugenia Hook Carter?], [19--?]
div1.p:
better than when on my Va trip,
- to Newport news. I am inclined
to think the dead rest lying
down- the few days after my
return from it made the
change

It was Cold, Thursday - (Wednesday
night was colder) & I was worried a-
bout Laura in Camp- It is a
shame that she, who will just be
able to stand it, by the skin of
her teeth - if indeed she be able
to stand it.- should begin in
met such atrocious weather - Wet
at first & then Cold- & I presume
very
4
very muddy. However if she
is still there C7 of the 6 of
the days will be gone tonight,
& today- here at any rate is hot
& should be bright & warm in Va.
How are you doing my dear?
Rather a small household just
now. L. makes more difference
in it than I do.

I am grieved to miss my
Iris, The most beautiful of
them- Pallida the Pallida Group
& the bright yellow topped over-
& some of the white topped, will
be blooming - this week.
